receipt.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something
receipt.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
Can you give me a receipt?
Make sure you get receipts for everything.
receipt.translation[0].definitions[1].no: be in receipt of something (=to have received something)
receipt.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the closing date for receipt of applications
The booking will be made on receipt of a deposit.
receipt.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The money has to be re-invested within 60 days of receipt, otherwise it will be taxed.
The customer acknowledged receipt of a shipment.
a list of those in receipt of (=receiving) unemployment benefits
receipt.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a written statement showing that you have received money, goods, or services
receipt.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Keep all your receipts for work-related expenses.
receipt.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Export receipts in January totalled £626 million.
receipt.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to write ‘paid’ and the date on a bill or invoice and sign it
receipt.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: One copy is receipted and returned to you.
